governance.chain: L0 Human → L1 LDS Kernel V1 → L2 Proposer

core.name: PROJECT SAINT Authentication
core.description: Authentication system supporting demo quick-login (for Nicole/Keith demos), Clerk production auth, and future GCP SSO integration. Demo mode NEVER hits real backend.
core.principle: Authentication gates access. Authorization (kernel) gates actions. They are separate concerns.

demo.description: Quick-login buttons for each role. Instant access with synthetic data. For demonstrations and testing.

behavior.backend_calls: ZERO — all data is synthetic, loaded from demo_data entity
behavior.data_persistence: In-memory only — resets on page refresh
behavior.kernel_validation: FULL — kernel still validates every action even in demo

clerk.description: Production authentication via Clerk. Email/password, Google SSO, magic link.

gcp_sso.description: Future: Saint-Gobain enterprise SSO integration. SAML 2.0 or OIDC.
gcp_sso.provisioning: JIT (Just-In-Time) user provisioning on first login

left_panel.white_label: Replaced by client branding in white-label mode

right_panel.content: Auth form — Clerk sign-in OR demo role buttons

demo_panel.description: 4 role cards with name, title, icon. Click to instantly enter as that role.
demo_panel.subheader: Select a role to explore the platform

security.audit_logging: Every login/logout/role-switch logged via kernel audit

react_component.description: Authentication component with dual-mode: demo quick-login and Clerk production auth. Provides AuthContext with currentUser, currentRole, isDemoMode, logout().
exports: SAINTAuthProvider — wraps app, provides auth context
useSAINTAuth — hook for currentUser, currentRole, isDemoMode, login, logout
SAINTLoginScreen — the login page with Clerk + demo tabs
react_component.code_reference: See TRADEOS_AUTH.lds.json for implementation pattern. SAINT auth extends with GCP SSO stub and Nicole/Keith-specific demo personas.
